data.title: Dakota Johnson's net worth, Wiki, Age, Boyfriends, Net Worth & More
data.meta_description: Dakota Johnson's net worth: Dakota Johnson is a well-known American actress. She is the daughter of actors Don Johnson and Melanie Griffith. Dakota made her
data.text:
Dakota Johnson’s net worth: Dakota Johnson is a well-known American actress. She is the daughter of actors Don Johnson and Melanie Griffith. Dakota made her film debut at age 10 with a minor role in “Crazy in Alabama,” directed by her then-stepfather Antonio Banderas and starring her mother. Born on October 4th, 1989, in Austin, Texas, Dakota is 34 years old. She has several siblings, including Stella Banderas, Alexander Bauer, Grace Johnson, Jasper Breen, Ridge Johnson, Jesse Johnson, and Deacon Johnson. Her partner since 2017 is Chris Martin. Dakota stands 5’7″ tall and has a net worth of $14 million.

Also Read :Tom Daley’s Lifestyle in 2024: Family, House, Cars & Net Worth (Biography)

Dakota Johnson’s Early Life

Dakota May Johnson was born at Brackenridge Hospital in Austin, Texas. Her father, Don Johnson, was filming “The Hot Spot” in Texas when she was born. Her maternal grandparents are Peter Griffith, an advertising executive and former child actor, and actress Tippi Hedren. Dakota is a half-niece of actress Tracy Griffith and production designer Clay Griffith. Her former stepfather is actor Antonio Banderas. Dakota has a complex family, as both of her parents had children with different partners.

Her half-siblings include:

Jesse Johnson (born in 1982) from her father’s relationship with Patti D’Arbanville.

Alexander Bauer (born in 1985) from her mother’s marriage to Steven Bauer.

Stella Banderas (born in 1996) from her mother’s marriage to Antonio Banderas.

Grace Johnson (born in 1999), Jasper Breen (born in 2002), and Deacon Johnson (born in 2006) from her father’s marriage to Kelley Phleger.

Due to her parents’ occupations, Dakota spent much of her childhood in various locations on film sets and premieres. However, she spent extended amounts of time in Aspen and Woody Creek, Colorado. During summers, she worked at the local market in Woody Creek. As a teenager, she was neighbors with Hunter S. Thompson. Dakota attended the Aspen Community School and later the Santa Catalina School in Monterey, California, for her freshman year of high school. She then transferred to the private New Roads School in Santa Monica, California.

Also Read :Cristiano Ronaldo Ignites Georgina Rodríguez SECRET MARRIAGE Rumors

Dakota Johnson’s Career Beginnings (1999 – 2014)

In 1999, Dakota made her film debut in “Crazy in Alabama,” where she and her half-sister Stella Banderas played daughters to their real-life mother, Melanie Griffith. The film was directed by her then-stepfather, Antonio Banderas. In 2006, Dakota was chosen as Miss Golden Globe, making history as the first second-generation Miss Golden Globe.

In 2006, Dakota signed with IMG Models. Although acting is her primary career, she has modeled for brands like Mango’s jeans line in 2009 and participated in the “Rising Star” campaign for the Australian fashion label Wish in 2011. After graduating from high school, Dakota took acting classes with Tom Todoroff until 2008. She then signed with the William Morris Agency and started her professional acting career.

Dakota had a minor role as Amelia Ritter in the Oscar-nominated film “The Social Network” (2010), directed by David Fincher. She also appeared in the fantasy film “Beastly” (2011) and So Yong Kim’s drama “For Ellen” (2012), opposite Paul Dano and Jon Heder. In 2012, she had roles in Christopher Neil’s independent comedy “Goats,” Nicholas Stoller’s romantic comedy “The Five-Year Engagement,” and the comedy “21 Jump Street.” She also played the female lead in Chris Nelson’s film “Date and Switch,” written by Alan Yang.

Breakthrough and Major Roles (2015 – Present)

Dakota’s major breakthrough came with the role of Anastasia Steele in the “Fifty Shades” film series. The first film, “Fifty Shades of Grey,” was released in 2015, followed by “Fifty Shades Darker” in 2017 and “Fifty Shades Freed” in 2018. Her performance in these films brought her international fame.

In 2015, Dakota starred in the romantic comedy “How to Be Single,” opposite Rebel Wilson. She also appeared in the 2016 film “A Bigger Splash,” alongside Tilda Swinton and Ralph Fiennes. In 2018, Dakota starred in the horror film “Suspiria,” directed by Luca Guadagnino, and the thriller “Bad Times at the El Royale,” alongside Jeff Bridges and Chris Hemsworth.

Dakota continued to take on diverse roles, including the drama “Our Friend” (2019) and the comedy-drama “The Peanut Butter Falcon” (2019), which received positive reviews. In 2021, she starred in the drama “The Lost Daughter,” directed by Maggie Gyllenhaal, and the comedy “Cha Cha Real Smooth” (2022), which premiered at the Sundance Film Festival.

Dakota Johnson’s Personal Life

Dakota Johnson has been in several high-profile relationships. She was previously involved with musician Noah Gersh and actor Jordan Masterson. She dated Matthew Hitt, the lead vocalist of the Welsh indie rock band Drowners, intermittently for almost two years until 2016. Since October 2017, she has been in a relationship with Coldplay’s lead vocalist, Chris Martin. The couple resides in Malibu, California.

Dakota is a tattoo enthusiast and has several tattoos. She has been named a brand ambassador for the luxury fashion brand Gucci. In November 2020, Dakota became an investor and co-creative director of Maude, a sexual wellness brand. In 2018, she collaborated with 300 women in Hollywood to set up the Time’s Up initiative, aimed at protecting women from harassment and discrimination.

Dakota Johnson’s Awards and Achievements

Dakota Johnson has received numerous awards and nominations throughout her career. Some of her notable achievements include:

People’s Choice Award for Favorite Dramatic Movie Actress for “Fifty Shades of Grey” (2016)

BAFTA Rising Star Award nomination (2016)

MTV Movie & TV Award for Best Kiss for “Fifty Shades Darker” (2017)

Hollywood Film Award for Ensemble of the Year for “Suspiria” (2018)

Independent Spirit Award for Best Supporting Female for “The Peanut Butter Falcon” (2020)

Dakota Johnson’s net worth

As of 2023, Dakota Johnson’s net worth is estimated to be around $14 million. Her wealth primarily comes from her successful acting career, modeling gigs, and brand endorsements. Dakota’s investment in Maude and her collaboration with Gucci also contribute to her net worth.

Conclusion [Dakota Johnson’s net worth]

Dakota Johnson has established herself as a versatile and talented actress in Hollywood. From her early beginnings in “Crazy in Alabama” to her breakout role in the “Fifty Shades” series, Dakota has proven her acting prowess. Her personal life, filled with high-profile relationships and collaborations, adds to her intriguing public persona. With a net worth of $14 million and a growing list of accolades, Dakota Johnson’s career continues to flourish. She remains a prominent figure in the entertainment industry, known for her unique charm and talent.
